name: Jamal Jamal
text: Called about inquiring assistance. Was told to call 211 and she got off the phone as fast as she could. This place has no real interest in helping. Showed no concern.

name: Becky Jones
text: Catholic Social Services is an awesome place. They have different programs to help people with different kinds of circumstances. ☺️ They help women who are in the family way (or expecting a baby). They have a wonderful program for women and their unborn baby. 🙂 They have other programs based on people's needs. They also accept donations from in-date food to gently used clothing. I highly recommend and trust this fantastic organization! 😀

name: Terry Dees
text: Are we helpful

name: Anne Malec
text: Thank you Catholic Social Services for all the help you give to our community!  I am proud to be a Catholic and the 1st to donate items to your shop where I know they will go to people in need.

name: erica ervin
text: I will never ever return here. I would never refer anyone to this place. I came here because the catholic services where I have been living was very helpful. If you’re honest about your situation here, they help you out by calling DHR on you. Typical judgemental people

name: Saphronia Smith
text: Very good selection of goods. And. Everthing was neat and in its place

name: Newlife Ocean09
text: I called to seek assistance on geting help with my light bill and they told me that I either had to be 2 months behind or I had to be in disconnect status. Soooo wow this is crazy.... This goes to show you why folks don't give a damn about catholics. They are not a place of help or need they are a busines just like everyone else .

name: Twinkle Davis
text: I don't understand how the Catholic Social services requires an individual to be 2 months behind on their rent or about to be evicted in order to receive an appointment and in return once the appointment is made the only assistance they offer is 200 dollars max.....That is not assisting individuals with staying off the streets. Especially families who actually had an extreme emergency. You expect them to pay the remainder of the balance before you pay the 200 dollars. If they were able to pay any of it I would think they wouldn't have the need to come to you for help. That is a slap in the face calling that emergency assistance. Catholic Social services should just shut down. There are people out here who work hard everyday and are hit with something unexpected and are faced with being homeless but the system rather help people who manipulate the system. Yeah this world is backwards....

name: Hope Brown
text: Was in and out quickly! Everyone was nice, and accommodating.

name: Teresa Starks
text: No help to me you have to be in their outlines of what they can do anything different they can't help or offer anywhere to help you

name: toni field
text:
I want to thank you all so very much for your help throughout my hard times💘... Ms. Condolette, my heart goes out to you. You were so very kind & precious 💝.
Thank you all💘.
J.F.

text: they don’t really pay much on utilities and don’t give the right information out. My whole appointment was a waste of time and it just seems like they want to get in your business just to preach at you.

text: I don't understand if a person is in need why you have to have a appointment a week or so away when you are disabled and you don't have power and all you want is a little bit of help just once in your life and you feel so humiliated as it is to ask and then they just make it worse and don't even help with any other resources that could be quicker for you, just aweful.

name: brandy sears
text: I'm here now and my mother and came in the same car. We were the first ones here and my mother stood outside in the freezing cold for the both of us because I couldn't stand with her due to the freezing temp and the most important fact that I have my 3 week old son with me. And I certainly couldn't leave my baby in the car. The older lady at the desk made me stand in the back of the long line even after everyone in the room said they didn't mind if I be seen at the same time as my mom. The man behind her said "well, we do care" and the lady said its the rules in a smart butt attitude.  Had to give a * to be able to comment.  This place needs better service workers and lean how to explain things in a nice manner.

name: AmandaLee SuddithGreen
text: I used to shop at the habitat but they are Under New Management and prices have quadrupled I do not recommend they have attached to anyone anymore furthermore the staff followed me around the store while I was shopping and made me very uncomfortable

resp.text: We are a non profit organization and our mission is to help families in need. Our merchandise is priced according to other non profit organizations. We have to make money to pay our employees, and utilities, as well as raise money for the Habitat homes. I am sorry you feel this way. As far as you feeling like you were being followed, I reassure you that if an employee was following you it was not done on purpose. If you ever feel like someone is following you again please speak with Nicole. We do apologize and hope that you will give us another chance in the future. Thank you.

name: Kathleen Coats
text: They have some really great secoind hand used goods. Also a clean and organized environment with very friendly and helpful staff. Me being a book worm was well worth the visit for me. Especially added to the fact of a reasonable price. I was a very happy patron 😊

resp.text: Thank you so much for your positive feedback!  We work hard to give our customers quality service and products!

name: Matthew Sufczinski
text: Good deals on household items for home improvement bought a door for $40 when i would up paid five times the amount at home improvement stores

resp.text: Thank you for your positive feedback! We strive to give our customers a good shopping experience with our discounted items!

name: susy forfa
text: Great used furniture and appliances at bargain prices.  Not easy to locate.

resp.text: Thank you for your positive feedback! Also big thanks for taking the time to find us, we know it can be a bit tricky!

name: Leah Miles
text: Was told this place had lots of bedroom furniture but couldnt even find a bed frame...tsk tsk

resp.text: We're sorry that you were unable to find what you were looking for. With us working strictly with the donations we acquire sometimes it can be tough to find the exact item you may be looking for. We hope you try us again in the future. Thank you for your feedback.

text: Nice place to shop if you want good used furniture

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback! We work hard to acquire donations in good condition. Glad it's noticed!

text: Great place to look for recycled building materials, or to donate reusable building materials.

resp.text: Thank you for your review!

name: cindy2003smith
text: The prices have gone up recently but you can still find some bargains. They have furniture, knick-knacks and housewares as well as architectural items.

resp.text: Thanks for the positive feedback! We've been putting much focus on our pricing policy in the last several months. We always want our customers to feel like they got a good deal!

name: Velvet c
text: Terrible furniture. Don't bother wasting your time

resp.text: We're sorry that you had a poor experience in our store. All of our furniture is donated by the public so therefore we acquire used furniture. People make donations to contribute to our mission which is: Seeking to put God's love into action, Habitat for Humanity brings people together to build homes, communities and hope. Once again, sorry you had a poor experience. Thank you for your feedback.

name: Milly Brent
text: Great home finds!

resp.text: Thanks for the positive feedback!

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to leave feedback. We hope to have you as a returning customer as we have been working very hard to fill our ReStore with quality donations.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback! We strive to give our customers good items at a low rate so we appreciate you taking notice and taking the time to leave us a review.

resp.text: We are sorry you feel this way and would appreciate if you gave us another shot. We've been working hard to acquire quality donations and price them reasonably. Thank you for your feedback.

resp.text: Thanks for the positive feedback!

resp.text: Thank you for the positive feedback! Customer service is something we work hard on here at the ReStore as it is highly important to us. Glad you noticed and took the time to leave us a review!

name: Christopher Moore
text: Great place

resp.text: Thank you for the positive feedback! We hope to have you return and we'll strive to earn those remaining two stars!

name: Steve Willingham
text: Over priced

resp.text: We are sorry that our items may seem overpriced. We work strictly with the donations we receive and price them as fair as we can with our knowledge of the items. We also frequently mark our items down to ensure that items that may be overpriced eventually make their way out the door. Thank you for your feedback.

name: Dillon Hollis
text:
There was a decent amount of stuff to choose from.
Nothing of which i was looking for.
It doesn’t have that “thrift store smell” otherwise I would have given it a 5 star review instead of a 4.

resp.text: Thank you Dillion. Please check out our two Florence locations next time. They are located at 405 N. Mall Ct, Florence, AL 35630 and 3510 Cloverdale Rd., Florence, AL 35633.

Visited store fire the first time 5-21-20 and found it to be a great shopping experience!
Great selection and staff!

resp.text: Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Robin Featherston
text: I am amazed how clean the items are. Most thrift stores have a funky smell and I end up sneezing. Loaves and Fishes is a nice change.

text: Wonderful as always. It has never not been a pleasurable experience.

text: Had changed.. Way to high on their stuff! Use to love it. Not now

text: For a small place they have a pretty good selection

text: I have worked at Loaves and Fishes for over 2 years now and I love my job and the customers are amazing.

text: Nicely organized. Employees are super friendly

text: The sweetest most caring people

name: Kelli Lovelace
text: Great thrift store. Very organized.

name: mercymade8
text:
Everything has changed in the Loaves & Fishes stores they look nice but the prices have went up. From what i gather, management has changed.
I used to would shop at several of the locations at least once a week. I would pick up things for others who were in need as well. If it didnt work for them at thrift prices i could afford to buy it & put it back til i found someone who could wear/use it.
Now I can't afford to do that. The last time I went shopping there, I came back with 3 used clothing items which cost me around $15. My mom came over with new clothes she had gotten on sell fot $1 at Walmart. The point of thrifting is being thrifty. JCPenny's & other department stores has new clothes for clearance around these prices.
I enjoy the "treasure seeking" process of going to the thrift store but it is more fun when the treasure wasn't wrestling for a spot in your budget.
I'm not the only one who feels this way. The parking lots used to stay full of customers. Now nit nearly as much traffic goes through there to weed through the donated goods. Thankfully there are more & more options popping up around our area.
I will still go by there sometimes but not my go to spots anymore.

name: Linda Roberts
text: The prices are getting too high for me. Their prices was reasonable but not worth the drive now

name: Keda Johnson
text: Some things are over priced. But overall good store to get used items.

text: Very well organized shop.

name: Clay Barnett
text: Working to #endchildhoodcancer

name: John Estes
text: Giving blood here is relatively easy, however, just know that if you make an appointment for a certain time there is no guarantee you will be able to donate at that time.  As an example, if you have an appointment for, say, 11:00am to do a Power Red donation and someone walks in at 10 minutes before your appointment time and wants to do a Power Red donation, they will start the walk in and make you wait the approximately 30-45 minutes past your appointment time for them to finish.  So, your appointment time means nothing.

name: Brittany Best
text: I just volunteered and it was very helpful with training and super nice staff!

name: Richard Koerner
text: Have given blood several times here.  Had an appointment a while back and due to circumstances beyond my control I had to cancel.  The employee I spoke with was very rude.  When another representative called me back a few weeks later and I told him to take me off their list and I told him why.  He berated me.  I will give blood through Life South in the future.

name: Damon Davis
text: This mission is one of the more impressive organizations in Birmingham. You don’t hear their name often because much of what they do is not publicized. Tracy Hipps and his team seem to have their hands in charitable acts throughout all of Birmingham. This place feeds people, clothes them, provides medical supplies, restore homes and the list goes on and on. I love their vision, faith, and resolve to help others in their community.

name: Ronny Perkins
text: Great place. Service to the community in a Christ centered program.

name: rhonda jo
text: Through Pulix I was able to volunteer services in helping children with school necessities. I found out that this project is apart of a well put together Ministry that  educates children in reading (preparing them for a successful life) and also help the parents as well! HEARTFELT! I'm waiting on the next opportunity to help. Beautiful.

name: LINDA Mcginnis
text: Wonderful people loving the Lord to help serve

name: Wanda
text: GDD Geraldine Taylor, and other members of Dist  #13 Order of Eastern Star, delivered items to the Misson for delivery to  the Bahamas.  WE WERE BLESSED TO BE A BLESSING!!!! Christian Service Mission is wonderful.❤

name: Janet
text: I just love going to Christian Services, the Staff is always Cheerful and want to help in any way. If Your looking for a Christian atmosphere to donate Your time and or to donate items or money then they are the ones. Don't take my word for it you will want to go back again and again.

name: Brandon Johnson

text: This week was our first experience with this group of wonderful people......such a Blessing to meet each one ,and work along side other groups.......Thank you for all that you do for the Glory of God.......Roger Kirkland First Baptist Bells Tennessee .......Love you all

text: Bought a washing machine for a great price.  The staff there was very friendly and helpful not to mention it's for a great cause. Definitely will be back

resp.text: Thank YOU so very much for your support and for awesome review! We pour our hearts into making a difference and with your purchase, we are able to stay strong and do so much more for one in need!

name: Kelly S. Atchison
text: I first met Keli in 2012 through work and now have the honor of working with her on different projects for Hatching Hope these past few years. It has been truly incredible watching her and her son take a small, yet ambitious idea and turn it into an organization that has helped so many in such a short period of time! The Birmingham apartment community is lucky to have Keli and her team. They care deeply for people, which pushes them to reach far and beyond Birmingham to provide disaster relief for those in need. Keli and Jessica, keep after it! You're making a difference in the lives of so many! And to those reading this review, YOU can help support Hatching Hope by shopping their Thrift Studio in Alabaster, AL!

name: Melissa Howell
text: Really helpful people.
